title: Largest number of molecules in a sample

content.description:
Four containers each hold a sample of <math alttext="O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </math>, as shown in the table.

Container
 A

 C
 D

Pressure

 <math alttext="1.0 atmosphere" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>atm</mi></math>
 <math alttext="1.5 atmospheres" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>atm</mi></math>
 <math alttext="3.0 atmospheres" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>atm</mi></math>

 <math alttext="200 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mn>200</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></math>

Volume

 <math alttext="0.5 liter" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.50</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">L</mi></math>
content.question: Based on the information in the table, which container has the largest number of <math alttext="O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> molecules?

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
